subject: History
title: The Renaissance Begins
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Renaissance Begins.

hook.text: The Renaissance didn't start with a bang. It started with rich Italians buying old Greek manuscripts.

buildup.text: Florence's Medici family bankrolled artists and scholars, turning their city into Europe's cultural capital.

discovery.text: Brunelleschi built a dome that shouldn't have been possible. Donatello sculpted human forms with new realism.

twist.text: The Renaissance was funded by banking profits and papal corruption. Beauty grew from morally murky soil.

climax.text: Within a century, da Vinci, Michelangelo, and Raphael redefined what humans could create.

punchline.text: Europe's rebirth was bankrolled by bankers.

quiz.question: Who primarily funded the early Renaissance in Florence?
